testprocedure.test-case-summary: This test procedure is called by a test case and is used to verify the SUTs support of the dlDeviceCancelControlRequest dialog as an EC using variables provided by the calling test case. This procedure supports verification of requirements related to user need 2.3.5.9.6 [Need to Cancel Ramp Meter Control Requests] and is used for both valid and invalid test cases.

testStep.functionId: Step 1 CONFIGURE: Determine the Application Layer Standard that will be used for this test. RECORD this information as: ApplicationLayerStandard: ${ApplicationLayerStandard}

Step 2 CONFIGURE: Determine the dialog performance requirement for Send Cancel Control Response Upon Request (NTRM 3.3.5.1.6.1}. RECORD this value as: TMDD_N82R421_Send_Cancel_Control_Response_Upon_Request_Parameter = ${TMDD_N82R421_Send_Cancel_Control_Response_Upon_Request_Parameter}

Step 3 CONFIGURE: Determine the dialog performance requirement for Cancel Control Requests for Remote Ramp Meter (NTRM 3.3.5.10.5.1}. RECORD this value as: TMDD_N82R904_Cancel_Control_Requests_for_Remote_Ramp_Meter_Parameter = ${TMDD_N82R904_Cancel_Control_Requests_for_Remote_Ramp_Meter_Parameter}

Step 4 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Operator Identifier - Cancel Device Control is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.6.2.2.1). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N82R424_Operator_Identifier___Cancel_Device_Control_Supported = ${TMDD_N82R424_Operator_Identifier___Cancel_Device_Control_Supported}
Step 5 CONFIGURE: Define the response message that will be sent to the SUT. RECORD this information as: ResponseMessage: ${ResponseMessage}
Step 6 CONFIGURE: Determine whether the Authentication parameters need to be verified within this test. RECORD this information as: AuthenticationCheck: ${AuthenticationCheck}
Step 7 CONFIGURE: Identify the Username expected for authentication during this test. RECORD this information as: Username: ${Username}
Step 8 CONFIGURE: Identify the Password expected for authentication during this test. RECORD this information as: Password: ${Password}
Step 9 CONFIGURE: Identify the Operator Identifier expected for authentication during this test. RECORD this information as: OperatorID: ${OperatorID}
Step 10 CONFIGURE: Determine whether the SUT will be allowed access to the information requested in this test. RECORD this information as: AllowAccess: ${AllowAccess}
Step 11 CONFIGURE: Determine whether an error response message is expected for this test. RECORD this information as: ErrorResponseExpected: ${ErrorResponseExpected}
Step 12 CONFIGURE: IF ErrorResponseExpected is true, determine the expected error code response for this test. RECORD this information as: ErrorTypeExpected: ${ErrorTypeExpected}
Step 13 CONFIGURE: Determine whether the SUT is expected to have valid data available for a response message in this test. RECORD this information as: DataValid: ${DataValid}

Step 14 REQUEST-RESPONSE-OC-RECEIVE with the following parameters: DIALOG=dlDeviceCancelControlRequest RESPONSETIMEREQUIRED=TMDD_N82R421_Send_Cancel_Control_Response_Upon_Request_Parameter AUTHENTICATIONCHECK = AuthenticationCheck USERNAME = Username PASSWORD = Password OPERATORID = OperatorID ALLOWACCESS = AllowAccess ERRORRESPONSEEXPECTED = ErrorResponseExpected ERRORTYPEEXPECTED = ErrorTypeExpected DATAVALID = DataValid

Step 15 IF ErrorResponseExpected is not equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE, OTHERWISE skip the following substeps. Note: If a verification step fails, then test execution will proceed at the next subsequent Post Condition step, if present. Otherwise, test execution will proceed to the final Exit step.
Step 15.1 VERIFY that a deviceCancelControlRequestMsg message was received.
Step 15.2 VERIFY that an authentication data frame exists within message deviceCancelControlRequestMsg.
Step 15.3 VERIFY that an organization-requesting data frame exists within message deviceCancelControlRequestMsg.
Step 15.4 VERIFY that a device-id data element exists within message deviceCancelControlRequestMsg.
Step 15.5 VERIFY that a request-id data element exists within message deviceCancelControlRequestMsg.
Step 15.6 VERIFY that a deviceCancelControlRequestMsg message was received.
Step 15.7 IF TMDD_N82R424_Operator_Identifier___Cancel_Device_Control_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 15.7.1 VERIFY that an operator-id data element exists within each instance of data frame deviceCancelControlRequestMsg.authentication
Step 15.8 VERIFY that the values within the REQUEST message are correct per the TMDD standard and known operational conditions.

USER-VERIFY-MESSAGE.functionId: The User Verifies the message content

testStep.functionId: Step 15.9 CONFIGURE: Set CONTENTVERIFIED to True

Step 15.10 POSTCONDITION: REQUEST-RESPONSE-OC-REPLY with the following parameters: DIALOG=dlDeviceCancelControlRequest RESPONSETIMEREQUIRED=TMDD_N82R421_Send_Cancel_Control_Response_Upon_Request_Parameter CONTENTVERIFIED = CONTENTVERIFIED RESPONSEMESSAGE = ResponseMessage
Step 16 EXIT
